name: NBN - card draw advantage FA
NBN - card draw advantage FA v2
description: RSVP with an Ash can prevent an early astro from hand without a san san. Also helps protect the sansan early or mid game when the runner tries to trash it.

name: Basic gabe
description: -2 FAO +2 Lawyer up

name: Total Denial
description:
My first criminal deck. The ideia is trying to slow down the corp with an array of events like Accoun Siphon, Emergency Shutdown and Forged Activation Orders. Two Levy's will allow me to replay these events over and over.

Gabe's ability & Desperado will provide basic economy enhanced by Armitage, Bank Job and Liberated Accounts, Dirty Laundry, Easy Mark, and Sure Gamble. Also Leverage could provide some steady credit pool for runs.

Inside Job and Infiltration will allow me some sneak peaks till my Special Orders come in handy to fetch the icebrakers needed to get the job done.

The idea is to run a lot with a very light rig. It's all aboiut runs & events.

name: ICE Restruction/Recursive Parasites v1.0
description:
Attempt 1, threw together fairly quickly, comments appreciated.

Recurring parasites and using wyrm to destroy ICE, whilst simultaneously making ICE expensive to rez on the CORP side.

name: Ultrafast
description:
Accellerated Diagnostic + Double operations (Mushin and SanSan) to fast advance everything. Trick of light to rearrange tokens and score agendas on the fly. PlanB and Junebug give extra resilencyagainst an angry runner (Mushin over Junebug = instant game).

It's still a draft but, concept is interesting. What do you think?

name: Santiago mad rush
NBN for Josh
description: A deck for my friend to use at Store Champs

name: Andy for Josh
description: Standard Andro for my friend for Store Champs.

name: One Night in Bangkok
description: This uses Reina's ability, Xanadu, and Rook to make rezzing ice expensive.

name: ICE Destruction/Recursive Parasites v1.1
description:
Aim is to use recursive parasites alongside wyrm to trash lots of ice, and use xanadu and ICE carver to help this goal whilst making ICE expensive to REZ.

Other basic breakers are mainly to deal with smaller ICE that would be easier to break traditionally than use a parasite on, letting you save the combo for the larger ICE.

name: ManUp Mode
description: This is prob. going to be my first Store Champs deck. Trying to get rush to work out of NEXT. An ideal start would be 3 ICE laid out, followed by a successful ABT on turn 2. After that, a push to score a Mandatory Upgrades by Turn 6 would be ideal. Deck then can FA for the win.

name: NBN TWiY: You get nothing! You lose! Good day sir!
description: Thoughts?

name: Gabriel Knight: Shadow Hunter
description: Knight is the theme of the deck, based on Indalamar's build. Going to be my first Store Champs deck. SOT can bring back a variety of tools. Deck can be vulnerable to Shutdown, so Fairie and Knight can serve a dual purpose there.

name: Quick Chaos
description: Traditional recursion deck, toolboxing for programmes as needed.

name: Gabe Entry-level (Core + TA + TC)
description: First attempt at a runner deck. Only currently own one core set, Trace Amount and True Colors. Feedback welcome!

name: Vamp Abuse
description: Vamp them and spam keyhole

name: Kit R&D Dance
description: R&D focused deck with WitRD and HQ interface for surprise factor once they cover R&D and Archives. The Net Shield can easily be replaced with another Levy or Tinkering based on your meta.

name: Professional Attack β v0.3
description: The goal is heavy attack on HQ and R&D with some credit denial.

name: HQ blaster
Dinosaurs can fit through Keyholes too
description:
Shapers can use Keyhole just as well (if not better) than Anarchs, and CT is definitely the girl of choice to try this, because of her extra MU. The tutoring lets you get away with one copy, you can play your cards out of order (Keyhole first, then Djinn, then Scavenge to move the Keyhole) and you have RnD interface for additional abuse.

Not sure if Medium is actually strictly needed in this particular deck, if I end up tossing it, then Djinn goes too (and I'll do something fun with the spare influence).

Since I'm already running Scavenge for Test Run abuse and Keyhole mobility purposes, Dino became the console of choice (also, it's her toy dammit!)

name: Reservations Please
description: Use expensive ice to protect sansan and win

name: Choke Hold v3
description:
Endless tinkering of my turbochaos max efficiency rig has led to Garrote in over cloak + dagger, which opens up some Jinteki hate. Modded vs. Personal Workshop is a question, as is what I should do with the last to 2 influence.

v3: - 1x Feedback Filter, +1 Kati Jones. Jinteki's soul didn't need further crushing, and I feel like I want more bursty econ.

name: Master Key
description: Choke Hold X Keyhole

name: Gabriel Knight
description: A Frankenstein's Monster, assembled from Asroybal and Indalamar's Knight-based Gabe builds. For testing.

name: Weyland: Toe Tags & Body Bags v2
description:
This is another pass at a Weyland deck focused purely on flatlining the runner. The changes I made are in response getting demolished by: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/1812/red-queen-s-master-key

I think I had too much big ICE in the last version, which became a liability when hit with Parasite+Datasucker.

Economy was also an issue against the Reina Keyhole deck because of her ability, plus Keyhole trashing all of my Econ operations. The Agenda suite is to help with that Econ.

I know this deck needs Jackson Howard, but besides -1 Ghost Branch, +1 Jackson, I don't see an easy way to get any Jacksons in. I need some advance-able traps, because most, if not all, remote servers are going to be ICEless.

I also thought about adding in some Econ Assets, but I don't see an easy way to fit them in.

The ICE is centered around program destruction, hoping to get rid of troubling things like Keyhole, Datasucker, and Magnum Opus.

Lastly, there's no longer any way to give the Runner a Tag on the Corp turn, so False Lead becomes particularly important.

As always help is appreciated.

name: LLDS Loop
description:
OK so this isn't tier 1 or anything but it's a lot of fun. The idea is pretty simple. Get your LLDS chips out ASAP and then just cycle your breakers in and out of your rig as needed.

Possible swaps include Exile for Kate, or Dinosaurus to make Inti suck less. Indexing would also be interesting, since you can usually get 2+ cheap runs on the turn you install a breaker.

You could also toss in Levy/Same Old Thing in case the recursion engine runs out of steam, but deck space is tight as is...

name: Exiled Recycler
description: Rapid card cycling with recycling and replacement of old software.

name: NEXT Cybersecurity
description: NEXT cybersecurity utilizing deadly brain-damage bioriods.
